intro: Pilostaxis cymosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight hairy texture. Pilostaxis cymosa is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
